key_markers: IL7R, CD8A, CD8B, CCL4, KLRB1, ITK
reason: The presence of IL7R, CD8A, and CD8B suggests a CD8+ T cell identity. CCL4 is associated with effector functions, while KLRB1 (CD161) and ITK indicate a memory-like or tissue-resident phenotype.

key_markers: LAYN, HAVCR2 (TIM-3), TIGIT, IKZF2, KLRC2, KLRC3
reason: LAYN (Lag-3) and HAVCR2 (TIM-3) are markers of exhausted or chronically stimulated CD8+ T cells.

key_markers: GZMK, GZMH, PRF1, NKG7, CCR7, CD27
reason: GZMK, GZMH, PRF1, and NKG7 are markers of cytotoxic activity, typical of effector CD8+ T cells.

key_markers: WFDC2, CEACAM7, CLDN8, PPARG, HOXD13, HOXB13
reason: WFDC2, CEACAM7, and CLDN8 are markers associated with epithelial or secretory cells.
